form.title: Landmark Directory
form.description: Directory of iconic landmarks in Washington, DC including location, contact, and summaries.

entries.14: Iconic tribute to President Abraham Lincoln.
entries.12: A neoclassical monument dedicated in 1922, housing the famed seated statue of Lincoln and inscriptions of two of his most famous speeches.

entries.14: World's tallest obelisk honoring George Washington.
entries.12: An iconic stone obelisk on the National Mall, built to commemorate George Washington, the United States' first president.
Home to the United States Congress, the Capitol is a symbol of the American people and their government.

entries.4: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum
entries.14: Museum of aviation and space artifacts.
entries.12: Displays the largest collection of historic aircraft and spacecraft in the world.

entries.14: Official residence of the U.S. President.
entries.12: A historic and functional landmark where every U.S. president since John Adams has lived.

entries.14: Renowned art museum with international collections.
entries.12: Features paintings, sculpture, decorative arts, and new media from the Middle Ages to the present.

entries.4: National Museum of African American History and Culture
entries.14: Smithsonian museum focused on African American life and history.
entries.12: Exhibits document African American life, history, and culture, including slavery, civil rights, and contemporary contributions.

entries.14: Dedicated to Thomas Jefferson, author of the Declaration of Independence.
entries.12: This domed rotunda is surrounded by columns and overlooks the Tidal Basin.

entries.14: Monument to the civil rights leader.
entries.12: Features a granite statue of Dr. King and inscriptions of his famous speeches.
Still functioning as a theater, also operates as a museum and learning center.
